segments.text: I see the water just pouring out of the sink, and the woman doesn’t even seem to care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her foot is in the puddle, but she’s still drying that plate like nothing’s happening.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if she’s just ignoring it or if she’s really that oblivious.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The kids are sneaking cookies, and she’s completely missing it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the whole kitchen is going to flood if she doesn’t turn off the water soon.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The cabinets are already getting soaked, and she’s still just standing there.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe how calm she looks while everything is going wrong around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is about to fall, and she’s not even looking.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel like this is one of those moments where everything could go wrong at once.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But she’s still just drying that plate, like the world isn’t falling apart.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if she’ll even notice when the stool tips over.
segments.speaker: PAR
